title: Will the U.S. Education Department's plan to lower monthly payments for student loan borrowers be fully implemented by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Education Department's plan to lower monthly payments for student loan borrowers is fully implemented and operational. Full implementation means that the plan is actively in effect and borrowers are able to benefit from the lowered monthly payments as intended. Implementation must be confirmed through official announcements from the U.S. Education Department and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the plan is not fully implemented by July 31, 2024, or if it is only partially implemented or still facing legal challenges that prevent full implementation, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a lower court's ruling against the U.S. Education Department's student loan repayment plan be reinstated by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a lower court's ruling against the U.S. Education Department's student loan repayment plan, which was previously put on hold by a federal appeals court, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed through official court documents and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If the lower court's ruling remains on hold or is not reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, this question refers to the plan that aims to lower monthly payments for millions of student loan borrowers, as mentioned in recent news reports.

title: Will Redbox continue to operate under its current parent company by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Redbox remains operational under the ownership of its current parent company (as of October 1, 2023) by July 31, 2024. Continued operation and ownership must be confirmed by official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The question resolves as NO if Redbox ceases operation or is no longer owned by its current parent company by the resolution date. For the purpose of this question, 'operational' means that Redbox continues to provide DVD rental services through its kiosks or digital platforms.

title: Will Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment (CSSE) officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements. Emergence from bankruptcy typically involves the approval of a reorganization plan by the bankruptcy court and the company resuming normal operations. If CSSE remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or if there is no clear confirmation of its emergence from bankruptcy by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Colorado hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Colorado officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically addressing the enshrinement of abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Colorado Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and widely reported by at least three major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The referendum must be a binding vote, not merely an advisory or opinion poll. If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that the mere scheduling or proposal of a referendum is not sufficient for a YES resolution; the actual vote must take place within the specified timeframe.

title: Will Florida hold a referendum on abortion rights in its state constitution?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a referendum on enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be a formal, state-sanctioned vote open to eligible Florida voters. For a YES resolution, the referendum must specifically address the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution, not just general abortion-related policies. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or Florida-based newspapers of record). If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Maryland hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Maryland officially conducts a statewide referendum on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally organized by the state government and widely reported by at least three major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). For a YES resolution, the referendum must specifically address the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution, not just general abortion-related legislation. If no such referendum occurs or is officially scheduled to occur by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. The mere proposal or discussion of a potential referendum without an official scheduling does not qualify for a YES resolution.

title: Will Nevada hold a referendum on abortion rights in its state constitution?

The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government sources or reports from at least three major, reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will South Dakota hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, South Dakota officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically addressing the enshrinement of abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be verified by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, or Fox News) or by official state government announcements. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if the referendum held does not specifically address the enshrinement of abortion rights in the state constitution. Note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

title: Will Steve Bannon complete a four-month prison sentence by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is confirmation that Steve Bannon has completed a four-month prison sentence related to contempt charges. The completion must be verified through official records or announcements from relevant legal authorities, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If no such confirmation is available by the resolution date, or if Bannon's sentence is shortened, commuted, or he is released early for any reason, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will North Carolina hospitals write off at least $1 billion in medical debt?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is confirmed through official reports or statements by the North Carolina state government, participating hospitals, or at least three major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local North Carolina news stations) that hospitals in North Carolina have collectively written off at least $1 billion in medical debt for low- and middle-income residents. The debt write-off must be part of the state government's incentive program as mentioned in the news article. The confirmation must include the specific amount written off, which should meet or exceed $1 billion. If no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, or if the confirmed amount is less than $1 billion, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will at least 50% of North Carolina hospitals participate in a state medical debt relief program by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is confirmed through official reports or statements by the North Carolina state government or at least three major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local North Carolina newspapers) that 50% or more of hospitals in North Carolina are participating in a state-initiated medical debt relief program. The program should be aimed at relieving medical debt for low- and middle-income residents. For the purpose of this question, 'participating' means the hospital has agreed to take part in the program and has begun the process of relieving eligible patients' medical debt. The percentage will be calculated based on the total number of hospitals in North Carolina as reported by the state's Department of Health and Human Services or a similarly authoritative source. If less than 50% participation is confirmed by the resolution date, or if there is insufficient evidence to determine the participation rate, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the EU initiate formal legal proceedings against Meta Platforms by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the European Union officially initiates formal legal proceedings against Meta Platforms (formerly Facebook) regarding its digital competition practices or user data policies. The legal action must be distinct from and additional to the accusation mentioned in the October 2023 news about Meta's ad-free subscription model. To qualify, the legal proceedings must be publicly announced by an authorized EU body (such as the European Commission) and reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). Formal legal proceedings include but are not limited to: filing a lawsuit, initiating an antitrust investigation, or issuing a formal Statement of Objections. Mere warnings, informal discussions, or continued deliberations about existing cases do not count. If no such additional formal legal action is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Boeing announce any delays in its acquisition of Spirit AeroSystems by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Boeing publicly announces any delays in the acquisition process of Spirit AeroSystems by July 31, 2024. The delay must be officially communicated through Boeing's press releases, regulatory filings, or statements from authorized company representatives. A delay announcement could include, but is not limited to, extensions of the expected closing date, additional regulatory review periods, or any other factors that postpone the completion of the acquisition beyond initially projected timelines. If no such delay is announced by the specified date, or if the acquisition is completed without any announced delays, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider unofficial reports or speculations about potential delays.

title: Will Spirit AeroSystems shareholders approve an acquisition by a major aerospace company by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Spirit AeroSystems shareholders approve an acquisition by a major aerospace company by July 31, 2024. Approval must be confirmed through an official announcement by Spirit AeroSystems or the acquiring company, or through regulatory filings. The acquiring company must be one of the top 5 aerospace manufacturers by revenue as of October 1, 2023. If the shareholders do not approve such an acquisition by the specified date, or if no such acquisition is proposed, the question resolves as NO.
